alert.note: Alert for Benton; Jasper; Lake; Newton; Porter (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 18 at 3:34PM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...THREAT FOR RIVER ICE FORMATION AND ICE JAMS RETURNS THIS WEEK... Very cold temperatures will return to the area by Thursday morning, which will bring back favorable conditions for river ice formation. River ice may form and expand rapidly on the following rivers and their tributaries: Rock, Fox, DuPage, Des Plaines, Kankakee, and Vermilion. Ice jams will also be possible which may cause rises on rivers with little warning. Temperatures favorable for river ice are expected to continue through until at least the weekend and may remain favorable for river ice into next week, although confidence is low at this time. River water temperatures are also near freezing on most area rivers, which may lead to river ice forming rapidly after temperatures drop. The highest risk of ice jams is expected to be on the Rock, Fox, and Kankakee rivers where river ice spotters, river gauges, and satellite data indicate that heavy river ice coverage remains in some areas. Heavy ice cover may also worsen on the Illinois River, leading to possible impacts to shipping. This outlook means that elevated river levels and localized flooding impacts are possible, but the timing, extent, and severity remain uncertain. Persons with interests along area rivers should closely monitor the latest forecasts. No additional statements for the ice jam threat are expected for this period of cold weather.
